Title: Science Adventures level 1 issue 12: Hassle-free safety
Author: Shel Sweeney
Description: Science Adventures is an ongoing series of science themed comic Tạp chí, originally published in Singapore, to promote science and language skills amongst primary school students. These full-colour Tạp chí are designed to stimulate children's interest in science and STEM subjects.

Title: The Young Scientists level 1 issue 136: Blowing at a wind vane
Author: Yu Chun Lum
Description:
The Young Scientists (Level 1) magazine opens up the world of Science to curious minds to prepare them for a fascinating journey into the studies of various Sciences in the years to come. The stories are creatively crafted and illustrated with animation of the highest standard in the comic industry.

In this issue, get to know why seawater is so salty, how wind can help us, the secret behind the guava fruit, and more!

Title: The Young Scientists level 2 issue 125: Magnetic levitation train
Author: Yu Chun Lum
Description:
The Young Scientists (Level 2) magazine reveals the wonder of Science by creating stories in comic format to assist children to better understand science concepts. The stories and content are designed with relevant graphics and colourful illustrations to help reader relate intelligently to Science concepts.

In this issue, discover the benefits of vaccination, learn how to grow your own spring onions, find out which kingdom mushrooms belong to, and more!

Title: The Young Scientists level 3 issue 101: Crocodiles' escapade
Author: Yu Chun Lum
Description:
The Young Scientists (Level 3) magazine explores further the intricacy and mysteries of Science with fascinating articles, challenging questions to enhance development of Science concepts, meaningful experiments to build confidence and interesting Science stories in comic format.

In this issue, learn about the modern wonder called barcodes, discover what a sponge city is, find out whether animals can carry out photosynthesis, and more!

Title: The Young Scientists level 4 issue 11: Are nuclear power plants safe
Author: Yu Chun Lum
Description:
The Young Scientists (Level 4) magazine strengthens children's foundation in Science and prepares them for their Science subjects in secondary school. The topics of the magazine aim to expose readers to more in-depth understanding of key Science concepts while maintaining the fun and exciting comic style which is the trademark of The Young Scientists magazine.

In this issue, explore the world's first floating farm, find out how canyons are formed, understand the fuss about carbonated drinks, and more!
